- Creates new APIToken document for subsequent requests

- Does NOT create club membership (legacy design)

TODO: Should create club membership automatically like CreateClub does

get.summary: Find email-less players that could be merge candidates for the authenticated user
get.description:
AUTHORIZATION: Requires valid authentication (authenticated user is the target for merging)

PURPOSE: Find players without real email addresses that have similar names to the authenticated user,
allowing users to merge their existing club registrations with their authenticated account.

COMMON USE CASE:
1. Club admin adds "John Smith" as player without email
2. John Smith later signs up with email john@example.com
3. John uses this endpoint to find his email-less registration
4. John merges the email-less player into his authenticated account

DATA MODEL CHANGES: None (read-only operation)

parameters.name: clubId
parameters.description: Optional club ID to limit search to specific club

parameters.name: namePattern
parameters.description: Optional name pattern to search for (if not provided, uses authenticated user's name)

post.summary: Merge two players (source -> target), updating all references
post.description:
AUTHORIZATION: No explicit check in service code

PURPOSE: Combine duplicate players by intelligently merging data from source to target player

MERGE BEHAVIOR (detailed field-by-field rules):

SCALAR FIELDS (string, bool, int, float, etc.):
- If target field is empty/zero and source field has value -> use source value
- If both fields have values -> keep target value (target wins)
- If target has value and source is empty/zero -> keep target value

Examples:
- target.first_name = "", source.first_name = "John" -> result.first_name = "John"
- target.first_name = "Jane", source.first_name = "John" -> result.first_name = "Jane"
- target.is_platform_owner = false, source.is_platform_owner = true -> result.is_platform_owner = false
- target.email = "", source.email = "john@example.com" -> result.email = "john@example.com"

ARRAY FIELDS (repeated fields like club_memberships):
- Merge arrays by combining unique values: [A,B] + [C] = [A,B,C]
- Duplicates are avoided by comparing key fields (e.g., club_id for memberships)
- Target array items are preserved, source items are added if not already present

Examples:
- target.club_memberships = [Club1(admin), Club2(member)], source.club_memberships = [Club1(member), Club3(admin)]
  -> result.club_memberships = [Club1(admin), Club2(member), Club3(admin)]
  (Club1 from target wins, Club3 from source is added)

SYSTEM FIELDS:
- id: Always uses target.id (source player is deleted)
- normalized_key: Regenerated based on final display_name
- created_at: Uses target.created_at (earlier creation date)
- last_login_at: Uses most recent of target/source last_login_at

DATA MODEL CHANGES:
- Updates all Match documents referencing source player to target player
- Updates all Token documents referencing source player to target player
- Merges club memberships intelligently (no duplicates, target precedence)
- Deletes source Player document after successful merge
- Returns counts of updated documents for verification

TODO: Should require authentication and ownership/admin rights for both players

parameters.name: targetPlayerId
parameters.description: ID of the target player (keep this one - usually the authenticated player)

get.summary: List all tournament series with pagination
get.description:
AUTHORIZATION: Requires valid authentication (enforced by interceptor)

DATA MODEL CHANGES: None (read-only operation)

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Maximum number of series to return (default: 20, max: 100)

parameters.name: cursorAfter
parameters.description:
Cursor-based pagination (use one of the following):
ID to start listing after (for forward pagination)

parameters.name: cursorBefore
parameters.description: ID to start listing before (for backward pagination)

parameters.name: sportFilter
parameters.description:
Optional filter by sport.

 - SPORT_UNSPECIFIED: Default value, should not be used explicitly.
 - SPORT_TABLE_TENNIS: Classic ping pong / table tennis.
 - SPORT_TENNIS: Lawn/indoor tennis.
 - SPORT_PADEL: Padel tennis.

parameters.name: clubFilter
parameters.description:
Optional filter by club IDs. Special value "OPEN" includes all open series.
If empty, returns all series. Example: ["98463678", "OPEN"] returns 
series for club 98463678 plus all open series.

v1ScorelineResult.title: ScorelineResult represents goal/point-based scoring (future: football, basketball, etc.)

v1ScoringProfile.description:
ScoringProfile defines how match results are scored and validated
for different sports, enabling extensible multi-sport support.

 - SCORING_PROFILE_UNSPECIFIED: Default value, should not be used explicitly.
 - SCORING_PROFILE_TABLE_TENNIS_SETS: Table tennis set-based scoring (best-of-3 or best-of-5)
 - SCORING_PROFILE_SCORELINE: Goal/point-based scoring (e.g., football, basketball, hockey)
 - SCORING_PROFILE_STROKE_CARD: Stroke-based scoring (e.g., golf, disc golf)
 - SCORING_PROFILE_WEIGH_IN: Weight-based scoring (e.g., fishing competitions)

endsAt.title: When the series ends (matches can only be played during this period)

scoringProfile.title: Scoring profile that determines how matches are validated and scored

setsToPlay.title: Number of sets to play (for table tennis: 3 or 5)

v1Series.title: Series represents a time-bound table tennis tournament

v1SeriesFormat.description:
SeriesFormat captures the competition structure.

 - SERIES_FORMAT_UNSPECIFIED: Default value, should not be used.
 - SERIES_FORMAT_OPEN_PLAY: Open play where any players can play matches against each other.
 - SERIES_FORMAT_LADDER: Continuous ladder where players challenge each other.
 - SERIES_FORMAT_CUP: Knock-out cup or bracket style tournament.

v1SeriesVisibility.description:
- SERIES_VISIBILITY_UNSPECIFIED: Default value, should not be used
 - SERIES_VISIBILITY_CLUB_ONLY: Only players from the specified club can participate
 - SERIES_VISIBILITY_OPEN: Players from any club can participate
v1SeriesVisibility.title: Visibility setting for a tournament series

v1Sport.description:
Sport enumerates racket/paddle sports supported by the platform.
Table tennis is currently the only fully supported sport but we define
additional values so that the API is future proof.

 - SPORT_UNSPECIFIED: Default value, should not be used explicitly.
 - SPORT_TABLE_TENNIS: Classic ping pong / table tennis.
 - SPORT_TENNIS: Lawn/indoor tennis.
 - SPORT_PADEL: Padel tennis.

totalStrokes.title: Total strokes taken (can be expanded to per-hole later)

v1StrokeCardResult.title: StrokeCardResult represents stroke-based scoring (future: golf, disc golf)

setsA.title: Number of sets won by participant A (0-5 for best-of-5)

setsB.title: Number of sets won by participant B (0-5 for best-of-5)

v1TableTennisResult.title: TableTennisResult represents set-based scoring for table tennis

v1UpdateMatchResponse.title: Response after successfully updating a match

v1UpdateMemberRoleResponse.title: Response after updating a member's role

v1UpdateProfileRequest.title: Request to update current user's profile

token.title: The token from the magic link (UUID format)

v1ValidateTokenRequest.title: Request to validate a magic link token

apiToken.title: Long-lived API token for subsequent requests

v1ValidateTokenResponse.title: Response containing the API token for authenticated requests

v1WeighInResult.title: WeighInResult represents weight-based scoring (future: fishing competitions)
